title: COAST ORB / arno van eyck after
description: Afterthought reaction orbital to those flyers, man. Do it. Talk to your stupid brain.

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "One of the flyers has gotten stuck..."
dialogueTree.text: One of the flyers has gotten stuck to the branches of a small brush. The sound of it flapping in the wind is an echo of Van Eyck.

links.title: You: "Grab it quickly."
links.text: Grab it quickly.

links.title: Inland Empire: "As your hand reaches for the small..."
links.text: As your hand reaches for the small rectangle of glossy paper, it snaps free from the branch...

links.title: Inland Empire: "...and is swept away, out of existe..."
links.text: ...and is swept away, out of existence.

links.title: You: "What the shit?"
links.text: What the shit?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Cold drops of rain fall onto your o..."
links.text: Cold drops of rain fall onto your outstretched hand. A slight tremble passes through it...

links.title: Shivers: "A GLIMPSE INTO THE PAST"
links.text: A GLIMPSE INTO THE PAST

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is looking at the sp..."
links.text: The lieutenant is looking at the spot you were reaching for. "Did you notice something important?"

links.title: You: ""Kim, I think I'm seeing Van Eyck p..."
links.text: "Kim, I think I'm seeing Van Eyck posters everywhere now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. Well. I'm not going to ask w..."
links.text: "Okay. Well. I'm not going to ask who Van Eyck is. I'm just going to assume it's your business and move on, okay?" He raises his collar.

links.title: Inland Empire: "And so all our lives become but a f..."
links.text: And so all our lives become but a faded memory, an ephemeral vision of a Van Eyck concert flyer... blink or you'll miss it.

links.title: You: ""No... I don't think so. It was jus..."
links.text: "No... I don't think so. It was just a reflection or something. Never mind."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "Let's get going. We have..."
links.text: He nods. "Let's get going. We have a case to solve."

links.title: You: "Am I hallucinating?"
links.text: Am I hallucinating?

links.title: Inland Empire: "No."
links.text: No.

links.title: Endurance: "Yes. It's likely triggered by a foc..."
links.text: Yes. It's likely triggered by a focal epileptic seizure in your temporal lobe.

links.title: You: "Is it dangerous?"
links.text: Is it dangerous?

links.title: Endurance: "I don't know... probably. I'm not a..."
links.text: I don't know... probably. I'm not a doctor.

links.title: You: "Oh my god, I'm going to die!"
links.text: Oh my god, I'm going to die!

links.title: Endurance: "Yeah, probably, one day. But not th..."
links.text: Yeah, probably, one day. But not this very minute.

links.title: You: "Okay, I'm done with this. [Finish t..."
links.text: Okay, I'm done with this. [Finish thought.]

links.title: Inland Empire: "At the back of your head you feel t..."
links.text: At the back of your head you feel the rapid beat of anodic music... then it fades away.

links.title: You: ""Never mind. Let's get going." [Fin..."
links.text: "Never mind. Let's get going." [Finish thought.]

links.title: Inland Empire: "Flakes of snow fall onto your outst..."
links.text: Flakes of snow fall onto your outstretched hand. A slight tremble passes through it...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Your outstretched hand basks in the..."
links.text: Your outstretched hand basks in the warm spring sun.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Things in the night are not what th..."
links.text: Things in the night are not what they seem to be...

links.title: You: "Did that really happen just now?"
links.text: Did that really happen just now?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Cold drops of rain fall onto your o..."
links.text: Cold drops of rain fall onto your outstretched hand. A slight tremble passes through it...

links.title: Shivers: "IT HAPPENED ONCE; LONG AGO"
links.text: IT HAPPENED ONCE; LONG AGO

links.title: Inland Empire: "Large flakes of snow fall onto your..."
links.text: Large flakes of snow fall onto your outstretched hand. A slight tremble passes through it...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Your outstretched hand casts a deep..."
links.text: Your outstretched hand casts a deep shadow on the ground...

links.title: Inland Empire: "The shadows play tricks on your min..."
links.text: The shadows play tricks on your mind...

links.title: You: "[Ignore thought.]"
links.text: [Ignore thought.]

links.title: Inland Empire: "In the back of your head, you feel..."
links.text: In the back of your head, you feel the rapid beat of anodic music... then it fades away.
